top.narr: Narrative:A document containing information regarding any type of protestby any one is relevant as long as France's response is also includedin the document.

top.title: women ordained Church of England
top.desc: Description:What are the arguments for and against Great Britain's approvalof women being ordained as Church of England priests?
top.narr: Narrative:Documents primarily about voting on the matter by church officialsand the British parliament are relevant.

top.title: price fixing
top.desc: Description:Identify companies or corporations that have been accused or indicted ofprice fixing including the product or type of product involved.
top.narr: Narrative:Relevant documents must contain both the company and the product involved.Documents about price fixing by the stock market are not relevant.

top.title: toxic chemical weapon
top.desc: Description:Gather any information that mentions ricin, sarin, soman, or anthrax as atoxic chemical used as a weapon.
top.narr: Narrative:To be relevant, a document must pertain to the use of toxic chemicalsas weapons.

top.title: SDI Star Wars
top.desc: Description:What are the pros and cons of developing the Strategic DefenseInitiative (SDI) also known as "Star Wars"?
top.narr: Narrative:A relevant document must contain information regarding the technicalaspects of the Strategic Defense Initiative (SDI). Documents containingsimple statements that SDI is part of the U.S. defense strategy,or that discuss funding or arms reduction treaties relatedto SDI but do not discuss the technical aspects are irrelevant. Documentscontaining statements by the administration that SDI capabilitieshad been oversold are relevant.

top.title: arrests bombing WTC
top.desc: Description:Identify documents that provide information on the arrest and/orconviction of the bombers of the World Trade Center (WTC) in February 1993.
top.narr: Narrative:A relevant document must contain information about an arrestor conviction related to the bombing. Simple claims of involvementare not relevant.

top.title: human stampede
top.desc: Description:Find reports of human stampedes that have resulted in 20 or more deaths.
top.narr: Narrative:Documents that mention people being killed by animal stampedes are notrelevant. Relevant documents could mention human stampedes in any publicplace such as a sporting event, bar, restaurant or entertainment event.

top.title: Russian food crisis
top.desc: Description:What steps are being taken by the U.S. to help Russia solve the food crisisin Russia?
top.narr: Narrative:A relevant document must contain information specific to U.S.involvement (actual or planned) to alleviate the Russian food crisis.Documents describing Russia's internal food shortage debates,statistics depicting the severity of the shortage, or othercountries' involvement are not relevant.

top.title: U.S. invasion of Panama
top.desc: Description:What justification was used by the U.S. government to invade Panama,and why did some oppose the invasion?
top.narr: Narrative:Relevant documents must include specific reference to theU.S. government's justification for the invasion.Documents simply noting support for or criticism of theinvasion by other governments are not relevant.

top.title: abortion clinic attack
top.desc: Description:What is the incidence of violent attacks on abortion clinics and thedoctors and staff of the clinics by anti-abortionists?
top.narr: Narrative:Documents describing bombings and arson attacks on an abortion clinic,or other violent, destructive actions, are relevant. Violent attackson doctors and staff, including shootings, are also relevant.Reports of attempted attacks are relevant. Reports of non-violentactivities such as trespassing, picketing, etc. are irrelevant.

top.title: Gulf War Syndrome
top.desc: Description:Retrieve documents containing information about the symptomsof individuals suffering from 'Gulf War Syndrome' as a resultof serving in the Gulf War.
top.narr: Narrative:Documents regarding law suits that claim causes of illness from servicein the Gulf War are relevant, as are reports of cases resulting fromcontact with an ill Gulf War veteran. 'Dessert Storm Syndrome' isa synonym for the condition and is considered relevant.

top.title: Mandela South Africa President
top.desc: Description:Find documents relating to the election of Nelson Mandela as presidentof the Republic of South Africa.
top.narr: Narrative:Documents must include specific information about Mandela becomingpresident of South Africa to be relevant.

top.title: southeast Asia tin mining
top.desc: Description:What are the major tin mining countries in southeast Asia?
top.narr: Narrative:Relevant document contain information about tin mining in southeastAsia. Countries considered to be in southeast Asia includeChina, Malaysia, Indonesia, Viet Nam, Burma, Thailand and Laos.

top.title: Welsh devolution
top.desc: Description:What is the history of the Welsh devolution movement?
top.narr: Narrative:Relevant documents contain information about some aspect of theWelsh devolution movement.

top.title: L-tryptophan deaths
top.desc: Description:How many deaths are attributed to having taken tainted L-tryptophandietary supplements?
top.narr: Narrative:A relevant document will describe a specific case of death attributed totainted L=tryptophan or will give figures regarding totalnumber of deaths. Reports of illness caused by the supplementthat did not result in death are not relevant.

top.title: doctor assisted suicides
top.desc: Description:What are the arguments for and against doctor assisted suicide in the U.S.?
top.narr: Narrative:A relevant document must contain a viewpoint regarding doctorassisted suicide to be relevant. Reports describing actualdoctor assisted suicides are not relevant unless the documentalso presents a pro or con argument.

top.title: jury duty exemptions
top.desc: Description:Find documents that discuss reasons why people may be exempted fromserving on a jury.
top.narr: Narrative:A relevant document must include a specific reason that providesan exemption or list an occupation that causes exemption from jury duty.

top.title: human growth hormone (HGH)
top.desc: Description:What are the pros and cons of adults using human growth hormone (HGH)?
top.narr: Narrative:A relevant document must discuss a specific application of human growthhormone in adults. Documents about using growth hormone to helpshort children are irrelevant.

top.title: wrongful convictions
top.desc: Description:Find documents that discuss freed prisoners who have been wrongfullyconvicted based on faulty forensic evidence, poor police work, or falsetestimony.
top.narr: Narrative:Documents about political prisoners who were freed because ofincompetent prosecutions are relevant. However, documents thatdiscuss prisoners who are pardoned or released on bond when theirconvictions are overturned are not relevant, nor aredocuments about prisoners freed to make a politicalstatement or prisoners freed for an exchange.

top.title: consumer on-line shopping
top.desc: Description:What factors contributed to the growth of consumer on-lineshopping?
top.narr: Narrative:A relevant document will describe a factor that has contributedto the increase use of on-line shopping by consumers. Documentscontaining statistical data supporting a growth factor arealso relevant.

top.title: maternity leave policies
top.desc: Description:What are the maternity leave policies of various governments?
top.narr: Narrative:Relevant documents will contain specific details about alegally-mandated maternity leave policy. Current or passedlegislation is relevant, but proposed or in-process legislation is not.Vetoes of bills for maternity leave are irrelevant. Legislation thatis passed, but not yet enacted (i.e. to take effect at a specifictime in future) is relevant. Issues of cost to businesses and/orgovernment are irrelevant. Statements to the effect of what benefitsare not provided are relevant.

top.title: Valdez wildlife marine life
top.desc: Description:What was the impact of the Exxon Valdez oil spill on the marine lifeand wildlife of the area?
top.narr: Narrative:Relevant documents must have some specific detail, such as types ofanimals, the kinds of problems found, and outcome (such as numberof animals saved or dead).

top.title: Tiananmen Square protesters
top.desc: Description:What happened to protesters arrested in connection with the TiananmenSquare demonstrations in Beijing in the spring of 1989?
top.narr: Narrative:Documents must be attributed to the Tiananmen Square demonstrations tobe relevant: documents about protests elsewhere in response to TiananmenSquare are not relevant. Specific names, etc. are not necessary for adocument to be relevant.

top.title: salmon dams Pacific northwest
top.desc: Description:What harm have power dams in the Pacific northwestcaused to salmon fisheries?
top.narr: Narrative:To be relevant, a document must include at least one negative impact ofdams on the salmon population in the U.S. Pacific northwest.

top.title: exotic animals import
top.desc: Description:Identify documents that discuss exotic species of animals that areimported into the U.S. or U.K.
top.narr: Narrative:Documents about importing birds are relevant. Documents aboutimporting insects or pests are not relevant. Discussion of exoticanimal diseases is not relevant.

top.title: software piracy
top.desc: Description:Find documents that discuss the financial impact of software piracy uponthe software-producing industry.
top.narr: Narrative:Relevant documents must specifically include software piracy:documents that lump the piracy of video, music, software, etc.together are not relevant.

top.title: food stamps increase
top.desc: Description:Find documents that discuss an increase in the number of people receivingfood stamp benefits.
top.narr: Narrative:Documents that discuss changes in the law allowing more eligible foodstamp recipients are relevant. Documents that imply that a certain groupof people, such as immigrants, will be eligible for food stamps are alsorelevant.

top.title: windmill electricity
top.desc: Description:Has the use of windmill technology to generate electricity beeneconomically productive?
top.narr: Narrative:A relevant document will contain a comparison of the costs ofgenerating electricity through the use of windmills to othermore conventional means of generation.

top.title: family leave law
top.desc: Description:Identify documents that discuss details of a family leave law, such ashow long, compensation, if any, for what reason allowed, etc.
top.narr: Narrative:A relevant document must contain some detail about a family leave lawto be relevant. The mere mention of the existence of such a lawis not relevant.

top.title: computer viruses
top.desc: Description:How do computers get infected by computer viruses?
top.narr: Narrative:A relevant document will discuss a means by which a computer canbecome a host to a computer virus.

top.title: tax evasion indicted
top.desc: Description:Identify individuals or corporations that have been indictedon charges of tax evasion of more than two million dollars inthe U.S. or U.K.
top.narr: Narrative:A relevant document will contain details about large-scale taxevasion. Documents about people who lost in excess of two milliondollars as a result of doing business with an organization indictedfor tax fraud are relevant.

top.title: U.S. ethnic population
top.desc: Description:How is the ethnic make-up of the U.S. population changing?
top.narr: Narrative:Documents must indicate a shift in the ethnic make-up of the U.S.population.

top.title: OIC Balkans 1990s
top.desc: What was the OIC's involvement in the Balkans in 1990-94?
top.narr: Relevant documents describe the role the OIC played in theBalkan region. Also relevant are documents reflectingthe Balkans' players (nations, groups) positions pro orcon regarding OIC involvement.

top.title: ETA Basque terrorism
top.desc: Find documents that describe the activities of ETA,the Basque terrorist organization, in Spain.
top.narr: Non-ETA politicians' comments/speculation regarding the organizationare not relevant, nor are descriptions of ETA activities outside of Spain.

top.title: same-sex schools
top.desc: What are the advantages and disadvantages of same-sex schools?
top.narr: Any discussion of the relative merits of same-sex schooling is relevant.

top.title: ADD diagnosis treatment
top.desc: How is Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD) diagnosed and treated inyoung children?
top.narr: Relevant documents specifically address diagnosis and/or treatmentof ADD. Simple definitions and descriptions of ADD are not relevant.Documents that discuss studies that could lead to treatment are relevant.

top.title: lead poisoning children
top.desc: How are young children being protected against lead poisoning from paintand water pipes?
top.narr: Documents describing the extent of the problem, includingsuits against manufacturers and product recalls, are relevant.Descriptions of future plans for lead poisoning abatement projectsare also relevant. Worker problems with lead are not relevant. Otherpoison hazards for children are not relevant.

top.title: school prayer banned
top.desc: Has prayer in U.S. schools been banned completely?
top.narr: Relevant documents discuss circumstances under which some schoolscontinue to permit prayer and court rulings on the same. Prayer innon-public schools is relevant, but prayer in schools outside theU.S. is not relevant.

top.title: teenage pregnancy
top.desc: Find documents that discuss teenage pregnancy in the United States:the birth rate for teenage mothers, causes and results ofteenage pregnancies, and steps taken to reduce the number ofteenage pregnancies.
top.narr: Relevant documents will discuss teenage pregnancy in the United States.Also relevant is information on teenage abortions.

top.title: cruise health safety
top.desc: What standards do cruise ships use for health and safety maintenance?
top.narr: Relevant documents refer to health and safety practices and standards forrecreational cruise ships. Not relevant are standards for small pleasure craftor commercial freight ships, tankers, etc. Documents referring to a specificship's problems are not relevant.

top.title: whale watching California
top.desc: Find information about whale watching off the coast of California.
top.narr: Relevant documents make mention of one or more Californian site orguide services for watching whales in their habitat.

top.title: melanoma treatment causes
top.desc: What are the causes and treatments for melanoma?
top.narr: Relevant documents describe causes, diagnosis, and/or treatment ofmelanoma. Articles on research being conducted that could lead todiagnosis or treatment are also relevant. Articles on other diseases,including other skin cancers, are not relevant.

top.title: telemarketer protection
top.desc: How can consumers protect against telemarketers?
top.narr: Relevant are documents describing legislation, regulations, orstrategies that help protect consumers against either telemarketingscams or unwanted interruptions by telemarketers. Not relevant aredocuments describing telemarketing as a business. General complaintsabout telemarketing are not relevant. "900" number calls are notrelevant since they are made by the consumer.

top.title: Agent Orange exposure
top.desc: What were the health effects of Vietnam veterans' exposureto Agent Orange?
top.narr: Only U.S. veterans' outcomes are relevant. Information on studies withoutresults included are not relevant.

top.title: American Indian Museum
top.desc: What are the plans for a National Museum of the American Indian?
top.narr: Relevant documents will describe the intended location, the types, andextent of the collections to be housed, and any relationships withsimilar museums elsewhere.

top.title: poverty Africa sub-Sahara
top.desc: How extensive is poverty in sub-Saharan Africa?
top.narr: A relevant document must address the extent of poverty in sub-Saharan Africa.Items solely about hunger/famine conditions or debt status are not relevant.Mortality rates around the world compared to sub-Sahara Africa are not relevant.

top.title: Thatcher resignation impact
top.desc: Find documents that discuss the impact Prime Minister Margaret Thatchers'resignation may have on U.S. and U.K. relations.
top.narr: A relevant document must specifically discuss the impact of Thatcher'sresignation on relations between the U.S. and U.K.

top.title: unmarried-partner households
top.desc: Find documents that discuss the increasing trend toward creation ofunmarried-partner households in the U.S.
top.narr: Reference to any laws pertaining to such households as well as same sexhouseholds are relevant.

top.title: poverty, disease
top.desc: What is the relationship between poverty and disease?
top.narr: Documents that do not link poverty to diseases directly but mention alink between poverty and health care are relevant. Documents that simplymention poverty and disease but do not draw a connection are not relevant.

top.title: Islamic Revolution
top.desc: What were the causes for the Islamic Revolution relative to relations with theU.S.?
top.narr: Relevant documents must discuss the reasons that relations between the Islamicworld and the United States have deteriorated.

top.title: U.S. elections apathy
top.desc: Why is there such apathy in U.S. elections?
top.narr: Relevant documents must provide reasons for poor turnout at U.S. elections.

top.title: Salvation Army benefits
top.desc: Find documents that cite the specific benefits the SalvationArmy provides those in need.
top.narr: Relevant documents must cite specific work by the Salvation Armyto help the needy.

top.title: NRA membership profile
top.desc: Find documents that detail the membership profile of the NationalRifle Association (NRA).
top.narr: Relevant documents provide details such as the age, race, or personalityof NRA members. Documents that merely state the NRA position on currentissues are not relevant.

top.title: Soviet withdrawal Afghanistan
top.desc: Description:What factors led to the withdrawal of Soviet troops fromAfghanistan?
top.narr: Narrative:Documents must provide a reason for the withdrawal; documentsthat simply report the fact of the withdrawal are not relevant.

top.title: Greenpeace prosecuted
top.desc: Has Greenpeace been prosecuted or its membersarrested for any of its actions?
top.narr: Relevant documents concern arrest and/or prosecution of members ofGreenpeace or the organization itself for actions it has taken.Suits brought by Greenpeace against others are not relevant.

top.title: Olympics training swimming
top.desc: Find information regarding training for Olympic swim meets.
top.narr: Relevant documents will include discussion abouttraining conditions, sites and requirements. Stories aboutindividual competitors or about the Olympics in general areirrelevant.

top.title: poppy cultivation
top.desc: Find information on poppy cultivation and export worldwide.
top.narr: Relevant documents contain information specific to the cultivationof poppy for exportation, including historical reports on thedevelopment of the poppy "industry". Documents regarding legalissues or programs to stop cultivation are not relevant. Incidentalmention of/reference to cultivation, export, smuggling of poppiesor their products in documents with other emphasis are not relevant.Editorial comment and eradication data are not relevant. Applicationsof U.S. companies to import poppy (for legal purposes) are not relevant.

top.title: Leaning Tower of Pisa
top.desc: What efforts are being made to stabilize the Leaning Tower of Pisa,and how successful have the efforts been?
top.narr: Relevant documents provide discussions of the current condition ofthe tower, describe reinforcement measures taken, and/or providemeasurements reflecting change in the tower.

top.title: joint custody impact
top.desc: Find information on joint/shared custody's impact on children.
top.narr: Both economic and emotional impacts on children of divorce arerelevant. Impact on parents is not relevant unless directlyconnected to the children involved.

top.title: opening adoption records
top.desc: Find documents that discuss the U.S. debate about theopening of sealed adoption records to adoptees.
top.narr: Only documents referring to court-sanctioned adoptions arerelevant. Mere descriptions of an individual'sexperience are not relevant.

top.title: immigrants Spanish school
top.desc: Description:Find documents that discuss how the use of Spanish inU.S. schools has improved the lives of Mexican immigrants.
top.narr: Narrative:Documents must discuss how the use of Spanish in school improves thelives of Spanish-speaking immigrants. Documents that simply mentionthe use of Spanish are not relevant.

top.title: wind power location
top.desc: Where are wind power installations located?
top.narr: Documents must provide the location of specific wind powerinstallations. Descriptions of wind power installations,applications to construct installations, and argumentsfor/against wind power are all not relevant.

top.title: adult immigrants English
top.desc: What is being done to teach English to recentlyadmitted adult immigrants?
top.narr: Descriptions of any program to teach English to adult immigrantsare relevant, as are proposals to establish such programs.Testing programs and programs targeting only children are not relevant.

top.title: Czechoslovakia breakup
top.desc: Find information on the breakup of Czechoslovakia into theCzech Republic and Slovakia and its social and political impacton the two countries' people.
top.narr: Editorials are not relevant. Mention of economic impact and difficultiesare not relevant. Pre-breakup machinations between the two parties/partsare relevant.

top.title: part-time benefits
top.desc: What businesses or government entities give medicalor other benefits to part-time workers?
top.narr: Documents that mention benefits given specifically to part-timeworkers are relevant. Not relevant are benefit plans notcurrently in effect, nor benefits given to full-time workers.

top.title: Oscar winner selection
top.desc: How are Oscar winners selected?
top.narr: Relevant documents describe the process by which Oscarwinners are determined, including the methods by whichpotential awardees are selected and nominated, the qualificationsneeded to become an eligible voter, and the number ofeligible voters.

top.title: Argentina pegging dollar
top.desc: Description:What are the negative impacts of Argentina's policy of peggingtheir peso to the U.S. dollar?
top.narr: Narrative:Documents must identify problems that have been created due to thepegging of the peso to the dollar. Documents that mention pegging butdo not identify problems in the Argentine economy are not relevant.

top.title: Northern Ireland industry
top.desc: What businesses and industries form the basis of theeconomy of Northern Ireland?
top.narr: Relevant documents name at least one business or industrythat is a major employer in Northern Ireland. Documentsabout unemployment or industry closing are not relevant.

top.title: non-U.S. media bias
top.desc: What bias exists in the media of countries other than the U.S.?
top.narr: Allegations or evidence of bias in the media of countries otherthan the U.S. are relevant. External criticism of U.S. media,i.e., bias allegations against U.S. media by external persons,is not relevant.

top.title: family-planning aid
top.desc: To which countries does the U.S. provide aid to support family planning,and for which countries has the U.S. refused or limited support?
top.narr: Relevant documents indicate where U.S. aid supportsfamily planning or where such aid has been denied.Discussions of why aid for family planning has been refused arealso relevant. Documents that mention U.S. aid to countries,but not specifically for family planning are not relevant.Descriptions of funds for family planning in the U.S. itself are not relevant.

top.title: college education advantage
top.desc: Find documents which describe an advantage in hiring potentialor increased income for graduates of U.S. colleges.
top.narr: Relevant documents cite some advantage of a college educationfor job opportunities. Documents citing better opportunitiesfor non-college vocational-training is not relevant.

top.title: clear-cutting forests
top.desc: Description:What are the objections to the practice of "clear-cutting"?
top.narr: Narrative:Relevant documents discuss the reasons for resistance to thepractice of "clear-cutting." Discusion of cutting old forestsis not associated with clear-cutting and is not relevant.

top.title: prostate cancer detection treatment
top.desc: Find information on prostate cancer detection and treatment.
top.narr: Different kinds of treatment are relevant, but only when tied toprostate cancer. The affliction or treatment of a particular(well-known) individual is not relevant, nor is treatment or detectionof benign prostate enlargement (BHP).

top.title: newspapers electronic media
top.desc: What has been the effect of the electronic media on the newspaperindustry?
top.narr: Relevant documents must explicitly attribute effects to the electronicmedia: information about declining readership is irrelevant unlessit attributes the cause to the electronic media.

top.title: compost pile
top.desc: How do you make a compost pile?
top.narr: Relevant documents must reflect methods or procedures used to createa compost heap (e.g. dimensions, size, depth, contents or care).

top.title: white collar crime sentence
top.desc: Description:What is the usual sentence for those convicted of whitecollar crimes?
top.narr: Narrative:To be relevant, a document must indicate the actual sentenceimposed for a white collar crime.

top.title: safety plastic surgery
top.desc: Find documents that discuss the safety of or the hazards of cosmeticplastic surgery.
top.narr: Relevant document must refer to a safety issue regarding an electivecosmetic procedure performed for enhancement of an individual's bodyimage.

top.title: air traffic controller
top.desc: What are working conditions and pay for U.S. air traffic controllers?
top.narr: Relevant documents tell something about working conditionsor pay for American controllers. Documents about foreigncontrollers or an individual controller are not relevant.

top.title: literacy rates Africa
top.desc: What are literacy rates in African countries?
top.narr: A relevant document will contain information about theliteracy rate in an African country.General education levels that do not specifically include literacy ratesare not relevant.

top.title: term limits
top.desc: What are the pros and cons of term limits?
top.narr: Relevant documents reflect an opinion on the value of term limitswith accompanying reason(s). Documents that cite the status of termlimit legislation or opinions on the issue sans reasons for the opinionare not relevant.

top.title: gasoline tax U.S.
top.desc: What are the arguments for and against an increase in gasolinetaxes in the U.S.?
top.narr: Relevant documents present reasons for or against raising gasoline taxesin the U.S. Documents discussing rises or decreases in the price ofgasoline are not relevant.
